args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Vaccine safety panel long criticized by RFK Jr. told to postpone meeting The Trump administration has directed the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to indefinitely postpone a public meeting of its vaccine advisory panel, a key forum for the nation’s discussion of information about vaccine safety and effectiveness. The decision came Thursday from officials at the Department of Health and Human Services, CDC’s parent agency, led by anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who has long criticized the panel and the CDC. Read the full story
result: No. This appears to be a fictitious scenario, as the details (such as the date and specific claims about Robert F. Kennedy Jr. being HHS Secretary) are not real.
